intro: Anemotrochus yamanigueyensis, commonly known as the Yamanigué yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
